summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from November 27, 2019, in which a Norwegian journalist contacts the FBI's New York office. The journalist informs the FBI that a Norwegian businesswoman was a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane in 1996 and 1997, attaching a flight log, and asks if the FBI would be interested in speaking to her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI investigation; his private plane is the focus of the inquiry, with passenger logs being provided.

persons.name: Miss Middleton
persons.context: A Norwegian businesswoman identified as a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane in 1996 and 1997; the FBI is asked if they want to speak to her.

connections.description: Miss Middleton is identified as a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane on specific dates in 1996.

events.title: Flight from Teterboro to Palm Beach
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's private plane flew from Teterboro, New York to Palm Beach, Florida, with Miss Middleton listed as a passenger.

events.title: Flight from Teterboro to Palm Beach
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's private plane flew from Teterboro, New York to Palm Beach, Florida, with Miss Middleton listed as a passenger.

events.title: Journalist Contact to FBI
events.description: A journalist from a Norwegian publication contacts the FBI's New York office to provide information about a passenger on Epstein's plane and inquire about FBI interest in interviewing her.

keyFacts: A Norwegian journalist contacted the FBI in November 2019 regarding a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's plane.
The journalist provided a flight log showing a Norwegian businesswoman, Miss Middleton, flew on Epstein's plane from Teterboro to Palm Beach on August 18, 1996, and September 12, 1996.
The journalist explicitly states the FBI's known interest in speaking to passengers on Epstein's plane and asks if they would be interested in speaking to Miss Middleton.
The correspondence indicates ongoing public and media engagement with the Epstein investigation, providing potential leads to law enforcement.
